fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the browser search function, the search does not pick up issues after adding the dash after the project key.

Ex.

Searching "ABC" is fine. Picks this up on the page.

Searching "ABC-" no longer picks up issues that match the criteria.
h3. Environment
 * Chrome
 * Firefox
 * Internet Explorer

h3. Steps to reproduce
 * Have a Scrum/Kanban board and some issues
 * Go to Active Sprint/Kanban board view
 * Press {{ctrl+f}} and key in the issue key (ie. ABC-1)

h3. Expected Results

Search finds issue named "ABC-1"
h3. Actual Results

Search does not find issue named "ABC-1"

 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Browser search function does not find issues after supplying a dash.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a board is configured swimlane based on Story, and if you try to flag this story, the flag is not shown until a page reload. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a board swimlane to be based on Story
 # Attempt to flag a Story swimlane heading

h3. Expected Results

The flag should appear immediately

h3. Actual Results

The flag only appears after the board is reloaded

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Story Swimlane flagged only after page reload

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

[https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.2.0/#api/2/cluster] and [https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.2.0/#api/2/cluster/zdu] are  missing some responses, the only responses listed right now are failure responses.

Please update the documentation with example successes :) 

However all the documented responses listed for all variants of these endpoints show red status lozenges and 40x responses.

Running GET on our /rest/api/2/cluster/nodes returns a 200 and the below content - which is what I would have expected for a healthy node.

It seems that only the failure responses have been documented.
{code:java}
[
{
"nodeId": "node`,
"state": "ACTIVE",
"lastStateChangeTimestamp": 1558542417237,
"ip": "xxxxxx",
"cacheListenerPort": 40001,
"nodeBuildNumber": 802000,
"nodeVersion": "8.2.0",
"alive": true
}
]  {code}

h3. Suggested solution
Follow a template around REST API documentation, an example of well-documented REST API endpoint: https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.1.0/#api/2/auditing-getRecords

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: API documentation for /cluster  missing all responses

fields.description:
Currently in Jira if you add a new user in the UI you have the option to send the user a notification. If the user is added by a directory sync the new user will not get a notification.

As an Admin I would like to have the option to enable by default the option to send a notification to the newly added user.
fields.summary: When new users are added to AD Directory Jira should send welcome message since they are a newly created user.

fields.description:
As a user I want to be able to connect to a Jira server over application Proxy in Azure using the Jira server mobile app.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Click ">" under Version Panel in Backlog page throw "Cannot read property 'doneEstimate' of undefined" error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new Scrum project with sample data.
# Go to Backlog > Version panel.
# Click on any *Quick Filters*, Ex: *Only My Issues*
# Click *">"* button to view Version details. 
 !SCRUM board - Agile Board - Jira 820 - Google Chrome 2019-05-23 14.19.18.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Version details show properly
 !SOF board - Agile Board - Amirul JIRA 7123 - Google Chrome 2019-05-23 14.08.57.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
*Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'doneEstimate' of undefined* thrown in UI:
 !SCRUM board - Agile Board - Jira 820 - Google Chrome 2019-05-23 14.12.55.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This also happen to Kanban project where backlog is enable.
Error did not happen in JIRA 7.13.2.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Click ">" under Version Panel in Backlog page throw "Cannot read property 'doneEstimate' of undefined" error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When selecting a quick filter in an active sprint or kanban backlog board that filters sub-tasks of a ticket that shows up in the swimlane will result in hiding the parent's status label and issue type icon.

h3. Environment

Reproducible on Jira 8.0.2
Not reproducible on Jira 7.7 and 7.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login with the administrator account
 # Create a Jira Software scrum or kanban project
 # Create a story and assign it to User A
 # Create a sub-task of that story and assign it to User B
 # Add swimlane to the stories, and add two quick filters - one to look for issues assigned to User A, and another to look for issues assigned to User B
 # At the active sprint view or kanban backlog, select the first quick filter to User A. The parent ticket will still have it's issue type icon and status label information in the swimlane
 # Unselect the quick filter, and select the quick filter to look for ticket assigned to User B (assignee of subtask)

h3. Expected Results

The parent ticket will persist with the ticket's information of issue type icon and status label.

h3. Actual Results

The parent ticket hide the issue type icon and it's status label.

h3. Screenshots
Without filters, expected behaviour:
 !Expected_behaviour.png|thumbnail! 
With quick filter to the assignee of the subtask, hidden information:
 !Hidden_IssueType_and_Status.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Quick filtering a subtask in a  board will hide it's parent's status in the swimlane

fields.description:
h4. *Summary*

In Jira 7.9.x, there is an bug reported [internally|https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/browse/SIN-952] regarding error in removing duplicated row. This bug will affect users who try to move issue in a specific project due to duplicated ISSUE ID and PROVIDER_SOURCE_ID in AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY table. The solution to this bug is to upgrade to Jira 7.10.

Please add this as a known issue while upgrading in both documentations [Upgrade Matrix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ug/jira-software-upgrade-matrix-933696761.html] and [Upgrade Note for Jira 7.9.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-9-x-upgrade-notes-947165815.html].
fields.summary: Include 'error in removing duplicate' row in the Jira 7.9.x documentation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Please think about adding to the Context Menu a Move to Top of Sprint and a Move to Bottom of Sprint options. 

Or possibly move items that are marked as Done to the bottom of the Sprint automatically?

The issue that I see is that on the Active Sprint Board items that are marked as Done are shown interspersed with items that are still in progress. To fix this issue and give users visibility into what is being worked currently, or needs to still be worked, I move items in the Sprint, on the Backlog View, to the bottom of the sprint. This becomes a little more tedious once you start to have a larger number of items in the Sprint.



Thanks,
Scott Mitchell
fields.summary: Top of Sprint/Bottom of Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: On Apr 25, 2019, [Jira Align (formerly AgileCraft) was introduced as part of Atlassian family|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Introducing-Jira-Align/ba-p/1068047]. However, Jira Align is a separately managed solution that is cloud-based. It would be great if it is introduced as part of Atlassian's self-hosted solution (Server/DC).
fields.summary: Introduce Jira Align to Server/DC

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If an issue is assigned to a future sprint, and the issue is closed before the sprint starts, the issue is removed from the future sprint without warning.

It would be nice if Jira either preserved future sprints on issues when they are closed, or warned the user that the issue would be removed from the future sprint, thus removing the issue from any sprint reports created for that sprint that are generated down the line.
fields.summary: Preserve future sprints when closing stories

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Many scrum masters will run through all the quick filters and use this as a reminder for who is in the team. This means that inevitably the teams get run through in the same order every day. This may mean that people who join the team later end up at the end of the list, and have limited time on the daily call. 

It would be nice if there was an option to shuffle the order of the quick filters every day (or at least some of them) so that it shakes it up a little bit. This would also mean that people would have to listen more closely to the meeting, as they would not be speaking in the same order every day. This would need to be optional, as some teams would not like this, but possibly many teams *would* like this. 

It would be useful if each quick filter could have a flag to see if it's included in the shuffle list, because some teams like to have additional quick filters for common searches which are not related to particular team members.
fields.summary: Shuffle quick filters for stand-up meetings.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Definition:
In the issue details' page right-side panel, there's a _View on Board_ link which serves as a quick way for you to see the issue in the board. However, it doesn't work if there are more than a hundred issues on the board. I understand that the _Show all issues (x)_ link is there for performance improvement purposes. However, JIRA should be smart enough to locate whichever issue, regardless of its position in the Backlog on the board. 

h3. Suggestion:
Be able to locate the issue in the board regardless of the number of issues and the issue's position in the backlog.
fields.summary: View on Board link fails to locate the issue if the board has more than hundred of issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Show more than 5 Bamboo builds when releasing a version from JIRA

h3. Current behavior
As mention in [Running a Bamboo build when releasing a version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/running-a-bamboo-build-when-releasing-a-version-938845520.html], currently JIRA will only take the latest 5 existing builds when user a trying to running a build while releasing a version from JIRA.
 !JIRA to Bamboo Development Panel Integration .png|thumbnail! 

This was hard-coded in Jira Bamboo plugin to only take 5 existing builds from Bamboo:
{code}
requestUrl = JBAM.restURL + "history/" + JBAM.jiraProjectKey + "/" + $select.val() + "/5";
            requestData = {continuable: true, buildstate: "successful"};
            successCallback = function (data)
{code}
(i) Refer to */5*, it only takes 5 existing build from Bamboo.

h3. Suggestion
It will be good if more than 5 existing builds can be choose from JIRA while releasing a version or make this number to either be configurable.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Show more than 5 Bamboo builds when releasing a version from JIRA

fields.description:
Series of events:
 * As part of next sprint planning, before closing the current sprint, each team stepped through items remaining in sprint backlog and took note whether or not they would go to next sprint or backlog.
 * Close sprint.
 * As part of closing out the sprint, we shifted everything to the next print that was incomplete, and then went back to noted items and moved them to backlog … manually.
 * Above solution forces a scrum master to track issues individually (outside of Jira) as part of sprint closure, which shouldn't be required.

We would like to see the ability to send issues to the backlog or next sprint individually at the end of the sprint, instead of moving all issues into one of two buckets.
fields.summary: Add more user control in where incomplete issues go when ending a Sprint

fields.description:
It has been documented that custom fields with global context can become a performance issue for JIRA, so the recommendation has been to limit each field just to the projects in which it is relevant.

As a Jira admin, it is difficult to manage the project contexts of a field in the current interface (as of version 7.10.2 at least).  The multi-select list requires that you hold down CTRL when clicking a project in order to add it to the existing list rather than replacing the existing selections, and you can only see a few projects at a time so there is a lot of scrolling involved.

Please consider changing this to be like the interface when adding issue types to an issue type scheme – two boxes, left and right, and you move items from box to box in order to include or remove them.
fields.summary: Improve Custom Field context interface

fields.description:
This relates to 
 # JRASERVER-66689

Which I made back in January of 2018 but now realize it was in the wrong spot and wanted to simplify it a bit.
h1. Overview

Currently in Jira Service Desk projects and (according to [documention|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver073/linking-issues-861257339.html] ) Jira Core business projects you can use an issue action called 'Create linked issue' to create a new issue that will be linked to the current one. I would like this functionality on Jira Software Project issues. Ideally this would exist as an action in the More menu that could also be accessed with the '.' issue actions keyboard shortcut to be accessed from the kanban/scrum boards and backlogs as well.
h2. Example

Often in our "software" projects (we use them for IT management operations) we are creating issues and then manually linking them as we find an issue creating new work. A bug that is resolved by changing settings in a few different systems, a task for doing an audit  of something and then a whole bunch of problems to fix, and so forth. It would be very helpful to not have to manually add a link after or during the creation of an issue. Especially since this functionality already exists for Jira Service Desk and Jira Core. We use it in Jira service desk, but more often need it on Jira software projects.
fields.summary: Add 'Create Linked Issue' action to Jira Software Projects/Issues

fields.description:
Hi,

We've used Jira Software for years for managing software issues.

We have recently added Jira Service Desk for our service desk for IT issues.

Service Desk requires that all users are logged on which means now the users are no longer considered "anonymous" so cannot see any Jira Software issues (as we don't have enough licenses).

 

This causes two problems:
 # users no longer have read-only access to all Software issues, unless they log out
 # when we move a Service Desk issue to a Software project (which we must do as we want the item moved from the Service Desk queue and into a Software queue as we have different processes and fields for Software issues) the users can no longer track the item

We need to move issues as we don't want our Service Desk SLAs affected by long-outstanding trivial software issue, and anything that needs a software release (for us) is *not* tracked as a Service Desk issue.

I believe that creating linked issues means we cannot close the Service Desk issue without also closing the Software issue, but even if this were not the case, still users would not have visibility of the progress and notes on the Software issue.

 

If, logged in users without a Software license were treated the same as anonymous users it would fix this issue for us.

 

Please can you consider providing this.
fields.summary: Allow logged in users without a Jira Software license to have the same rights as anonymous users

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a product manager I to be able to hide the Everything Else Swimlane on board.

Background: I've built a board to view a subset of the work in flight for our group so our Director is able to report to the GM on specific, but evolving buckets of work.  The board only displays Epics, and in our setup, Epics are children of Requirements.  

I designed 3 swimlanes, one per concept, that contain 1:many requirement links as the determining factor if an Epic appears in the swimlane. 

The problem is the Everything Else swimlane.  The only way I have found to eliminate the Everything Else swimlane is to duplicate the JQL for the swimlanes in the filter criteria.  

The result is every time there is a change in scope I will need to update both the Query and the Swimlanes, duplicating work.

I want the ability to hide/remove the Everything Else swimlane, and all of its contents, from view via the Board Configuration process.

This way I can send the same query and only need to update the swimlane JQL.

As 'Everything Else' is out of scope of the purpose of the board, displaying it just adds noise and the possibility of confusion by users.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Items that are in WCAG2.0 that need to be considered on the Agile board to make it compliant:

Principle 2 – Operable
User interface components and navigation must be operable.

Section 2.1.1 – Keyboard:
Level a.
Make all functionality available from a keyboard.

Issue: If the user can not detect which column an item is in programmatically, and can not drag the item between columns using a mouse, it has failed to meet the keyboard operable criteria.

2.4.6 Headings and Labels.
Level AA.
Headings or labels describe the topic or purpose.

Issue: The agile board has one heading for each column that the user can see. However the screen reader sees the headings as an ordered list:
list of 3 items
heading level 2 TO DO
heading level 2 IN PROGRESS
heading level 2 DONE

These headings fail to identify the sections they represent. Each ticket associated to a stage should appear under its specific heading. For example:
heading level 2 TO DO

TEST-1234 assigned to: J. Smith. Status: Ready for QA
heading level 2 IN PROGRESS
TEST-1235 assigned to: J. Smith. Status: In QA
The section headings are totally unusable for their purpose.

This is currently in all versions.

h3. Workaround.
Currently there is no know workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Atlassian list the Agile to be accessibility compliant, however this is not the case.

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master, I want to be able to use story points as a unit of measure in the various gadgets, specifically the pie chart, as opposed to issue count.

 

My current use case as an example: I want to be able to see the percentage of work being done in a current sprint as a function of story points, not issue count. 

Currently the Jira dashboard Pie Chart gadget accomplishes most of what I am looking for in this example. I enter in the query for the work in my current sprint and select "Account" as the statistic type, but the chart currently shows the distribution of work by number of stories, and I would like it to show story points. 

 

Acceptance Criteria:

-Chart shows pie slice percentages such that story points comprise the percent of the grand total (for example, “30% Project A” should mean that 30% of the current sprint's story points come from stories under Project A)

-Legend should display percentage of current sprint next to name of initiative so one does not have to hover over the pie chart to see the percentage

-Should be able to see total story points as opposed to total issues

-Should be able to select story points as a parameter in other gadgets beyond the pie chart, as that would be very useful too.
fields.summary: Jira Gadgets- Use story points as statistic option

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira does not take project permissions into consideration when running workflow triggers. This allows for users without *Transition Issues* permissions to effectively transition issues by performing operations in Bitbucket Server such as declining pull requests, for example.

h3. Suggested Solution
Jira should check if the user performing the action has the needed permissions before transitioning issues using a workflow trigger.

h3. Why this is important
Declining a pull request in Bitbucket as a user without *Transition Issue* project permission should have no effect on any issues in said project. A user not having the needed permissions can make a mistake and specify the wrong issue in a pull request, effectively circunventing the access controls deployed in Jira.

h3. Workaround
No workarounds aside from deleting triggers between Jira and Bitbucket.
fields.summary: As a user I want Jira to respect project permissions when running workflow triggers

E.g, an Issue is open. I add another Row next to this status named 'Awaiting Feedback' and add a Label 'waiting' to it.

All Issues, which are open and have the corresponding label will be shown in this row.

This gives users the flexibility to extend given processes without the need of administrative rights. Thus administrators will be able to govern their processes in a better way and give users the flexibility they demand

fields.description:
This came out in a recent security scan our internal Cyber Security team ran against both UAT and Production Jira environments.

*_The Web server allows form based authentication without disabling the AutoComplete feature for the password field._* 

*_If the browser is used in a shared computing environment where more than one person may use the browser, then "autocomplete" values may be retrieved or submitted by an unauthorized user._*

*_Contact the vendor to have the AutoComplete attribute disabled for the password field in all forms. The AutoComplete attribute should also be disabled for the user ID field._* 
*_Developers can add the following attribute to the form or input element: autocomplete="off"_* 
*_This attribute prevents the browser from prompting the user to save the populated form values for later reuse._* 

There's an article that has a solution for this security vulnerability at [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-disable-autocomplete-for-jira-login-fields-765399841.html] but this solution is not supported by the support team in Atlassian,  therefore we can't implement this in a production environment.

We need a way to disable AutoComplete in the login screen from inside the Jira GUI or by any other means that is actually supported by Atlassian.
fields.summary: AutoComplete Attribute Not Disabled for Password in Form Based Authentication

Currently story points field in a user story issue type is visible but not editable in the backlog view. It will be helpful especially during story grooming to let the user update that field from the backlog view itself. 

Appreciate your early reply!

Thanks
Sachin
fields.summary: Entering Story Points in the backlog view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

A feature of Scrum Boards is that issues can be created directly in the backlog or in planned sprints without needing to use the full issue creation screen. This allows users to quickly populate a board with issues.

 !image-2019-04-01-23-49-46-788.png|thumbnail! 

However, when a board uses a filter which contains multiple projects, users cannot take advantage of this quick issue creation, and are required to use the full issue creation screen. This is due to Jira being unable to determine the intended project the issue should be created under.

 !image-2019-04-01-23-51-29-504.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Suggested Solution

Administrators and Board Owners may wish to preserve the ability to use the quick issue creation in boards with multiple projects. To do so, they would need to be able to configure a default project for the board. This could be implemented in the Board Configuration.

h3. Why this is important
 
The ability to quickly create many issues in a board can save users time and allows for easier administration and usage.
fields.summary: Allow owner of a board which contains multiple projects to configure the default project to create issues under when creating issues directly in backlog or sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When user A creates an issue in the backlog by clicking the "Create Issue" at the very bottom, and the board has a quick filter of "reporter = user B" enabled, the new issue will have "userB" as a reporter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira as userA.
 # Configure a board and create a quick filter as "reporter = userB".
 # Go back to backlog screen in the board and select the quick filter which you just created.
 # Create an issue in the backlog screen under the last issue.
 # Open the new issue.

h3. Expected Results

Even if the quick filter is enabled, the reporter should be userA.
h3. Actual Results

The reporter of the new issue is set to userB.
h3. Notes
 * If userA is a Jira admin, the issue will be created with the wrong reporter. 
 * If userA is not a Jira admin, the error "{color:#FF0000}*Please fix the fields marked below*{color}" will be displayed, with no fields marked to fix.

h3. Workaround

userA should unselect the quick filter and create an issue in the backlog which populates the userA as the reporter.
fields.summary: Creating an issue under the backlog with a quick filter on a reporter results in an UI error and an incorrect reporter

h3. Issue Summary
Issue epic links created from the software scrum board trigger 2 issue linked to epic events

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using a Jira software project and scrum board
# Create an epic
# On the the above scrum board create an issue from that epic using the link in the screenshot
# The Jira api will trigger two issue linked to epic events.

h3. Expected Results
One issue linked to epic events is fired

h3. Actual Results
Two issue linked to epic events are fired. After looking at the stack-trace, it appears to setup the epic link on creation, and also set the epic link using a rest call causing the link to be set twice and two events published (see  [^first-event-trace.txt] and  [^second-event-trace.txt.txt] )

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue epic links created from the software scrum board trigger 2 issue linked to epic events

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user is a board administrator (and not a system administrator), they cannot switch to the Simplified Workflow, despite having met the requirements for the workflow. The "Simplified Workflow" button is disabled.

Granting the user administrative rights and refreshing the Column Management screen causes the "Simplify Workflow" button to be enabled.

[The Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver0712/permissions-overview-959315628.html] states that a user can switch if they are a Board admin, or a System admin.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# Create a new workflow, that has To Do, In Progress, Done (along with one outgoing transition from each status
# Create a new workflow scheme, and add your workflow scheme to it. Make sure to only use "All unassigned issue types"; rather than "All issue types" as per JSWSERVER-8720.
# Change the project to the new scheme
# Assign a non admin user to the "Administrators" role in the project.
# Ensure the "Administrators" role has the "Administer Project" permission and that "Extended Project Permission" is enabled
#* This is the default permission scheme in Jira software
# As the Project Administrator (but not System Administrator) visit the board and choose "Configure Board » Columns"

h3. Expected Results
The "Simplify Workflow" button should be enabled.

h3. Actual Results
The "Simplify Workflow button is not enabled.

h3.Workaround
Grant the user the "System Administrator" global permission temporarily, or have another user with that permission make the change instead.
fields.summary: Board Administrators cannot switch to a Simplified Workflow
